channel.title: Uncategorized on Eric Davis
channel.description: Recent content in Uncategorized on Eric Davis

item.title: Updates since last time
item.description: I was on this blog for the first time in months and realized a lot of what I wrote in the post before this and on the Projects page has changed! The biggest change is that I’m not renewing the ericdavis.io domain and have scrapped plans of moving all my projects to subdomains underneath it. Up until a few days ago, renewing ericdavis.io was still the plan but the Namecheap auto-renew failed (I hadn’t realized that simply adding a new card wasn’t enough.

item.title: The tallest man in history
item.description: As a tall kid, I was fascinated by this guy when I first read about him.

item.title: Hello World
item.description: Hi, I’m Eric and this is my new blog. I’ve tried — and failed — so many times at starting a blog it has become comical. I’ve tried nearly every flat-file blogging system out there. I’ve even taken stabs at writing my own. This isn’t even the first Wordpress blog I’ve started. Each time I get all excited for a few days, then just slow down, then stop entirely. Of course, I’m not alone in this.

item.title: Graphs and the y-axis
item.description: For as long as I've been aware of this sort of thing, I've always been under the impression that it is wrong to create a graph where the y-axis doesn't start at zero. And yet, here is a graph by Harry Enten at FiveThirtyEight that does exactly that: I remember being told in elementary school that doing this exaggerates the difference between values and should be avoided. Wikipedia seems to agree with me but also notes that it's okay to not start at zero when zero is basically an impossible value to have on the graph.

item.title: Why Wordpress?
item.description: I think that while most developers recognize that Wordpress isn’t terrible, it’s rarely the first choice for developers looking to build a personal programming blog. So why did I choose Wordpress for my blog? The answer in one word: laziness. Or, more accurately, lack of interest in yak shaving. I’ve dabbled with more blog publishing systems than I care to count. Like a lot of developers I was particularly interested in “static blogging” engines (e.

item.title: Hello World
item.description: Hello everyone. I'm going to be relaunching this blog over the next few days. This is the first post in that effort. It'll be mostly programming related (Python, Git, Emacs, RSS, etc.) but I may occassionally dabble with some political stuff. We'll see. I'm writing this post in Emacs and will be posting it with org2blog/wp. I like this system and how it feels. Honestly, it reminds me a bit of a simplified World Outline (something I have got to write about in the future).
